title: Bond Market Hints at Calm After Disruptive Selloff
sub_head: Yield on 10-year Treasury has recently slipped below 1.8% after nearly reaching 1.9% in mid-January
body:
Yields on longer-term U.S. government bonds have shown signs of stabilizing in recent days, easing the pressure generated on stocks by their rapid early-year climb.
Behind the move: deep skepticism among many investors that the Federal Reserve will raise short-term interest rates as high as they did in the last economic expansionâ€”a level that was itself the lowest peak for rates over the past seven decades.
